title: Jane Fonda accepts Bafta award while being arrested at climate protest
text:
Jane Fonda accepted a prestigious award from Bafta Los Angeles while being led away in handcuffs during her arrest at a climate change protest.

The 81-year-old actress and activist was honoured with the Stanley Kubrick Award for excellence in film at the annual Bafta Britannia Awards on Friday.

However, she could not be at the Beverly Hilton in person to accept the prize and, as is customary, instead sent a video message.

Footage of Fonda being arrested in Washington DC last week was shown to the star-studded audience on big screens, with the Oscar-winning actress shouting "Bafta, thank you" as she was led away.

"I'm very honoured," she added.
